title: Creating a reading list of articles on neural language generation (NLG) with a focus on deep contextual models and transfer learning involves selecting influential and foundational papers in the field. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"Attention Is All You Need"** by Vaswani et al
Introduced the Transformer model, which is foundational for many NLG systems
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Devlin et al
Discusses BERT, a model that has significantly influenced contextual understanding in NLG
**"Language Models are Unsupervised Multitask Learners"** by Radford et al
Introduces GPT-2, a model that demonstrated the power of large-scale unsupervised language models
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** by Yang et al
Proposes XLNet, which combines the best of autoregressive and autoencoding models
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** by Liu et al
Enhances BERT by optimizing its pretraining process
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Raffel et al
Introduces the T5 model, which frames all NLP tasks as text-to-text tasks
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"** by Lan et al
Proposes a more efficient version of BERT with parameter reduction techniques
**"CTRL: A Conditional Transformer Language Model for Controllable Generation"** by Keskar et al
Focuses on controllable text generation using a large-scale language model
**"DistilBERT, a distilled version of BERT: smaller, faster, cheaper and lighter"** by Sanh et al
Discusses a smaller version of BERT that retains much of its performance
Enhanced Representation through Knowledge Integration"** by Sun et al
Integrates knowledge graphs into language models for better contextual understanding
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Brown et al
Introduces GPT-3, which demonstrates impressive few-shot learning capabilities
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"** by Clark et al
Proposes a new pretraining method that is more sample-efficient than traditional masked language models
Denoising Sequence-to-Sequence Pre-training for Natural Language Generation, Translation, and Comprehension"** by Lewis et al
Combines BERT and GPT for improved sequence-to-sequence tasks
Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization"** by Zhang et al
Focuses on pretraining strategies for better abstractive summarization
**"Unsupervised Cross-lingual Representation Learning at Scale"** by Conneau et al
Discusses cross-lingual transfer learning using large-scale models
**"SpanBERT: Improving Pre-training by Representing and Predicting Spans"** by Joshi et al
Enhances BERT by focusing on span-level predictions
**"Reformer: The Efficient Transformer"** by Kitaev et al
Proposes a more efficient version of the Transformer model
**"Longformer: The Long-Document Transformer"** by Beltagy et al
Adapts the Transformer architecture for long document processing
**"mBERT: Multilingual BERT"** by Devlin et al
Discusses the multilingual capabilities of BERT
**"Unified Language Model Pre-training for Natural Language Understanding and Generation"** by Dong et al
Proposes a unified model for both understanding and generation tasks

These articles cover a range of topics within NLG, including foundational models, improvements in efficiency, and applications of transfer learning. They provide a comprehensive overview of the advancements in deep contextual models and transfer learning up to
